author: jlcheetah
title: Living Waters Costa Rica
description: Many projects focus on technology education; we need working models in the regenerative space applying the possibilities of cryptocurrency.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal didn't address any adoption and awareness for Cardano. The problem of this proposal is mainly for "Living Waters" and not about Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal don't have a timeline of how long the building is finished and the budget is not detailed enough. Only rough numbers of budget to make the building, meanwhile this proposal also need teachers to teach the classes. My suggestion is to get more detailed about the budget. This proposal doesn't have a lot of team member that needed to finish make the buildling and teaching the classes. My suggestion is to have more detailed team member and split the proposal into two proposal. One is building the building and the second is to make the classes.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer doesn't provide with clear metrics of success, as stated above the hub is to provide people to know about Cardano. Meanwhile the metrics of success is about the building standing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does not address the challenge. In the first place, the problem statement does not  really define a problem within this challenge additionally, the connection between the problem and proposed solution is not coherent. The idea is to explore the possibilities of cryptocurrency in the regenerative space however, the proposal's focus is on the construction of a physical space that would be used for events, retreats etc. to foster innovation. Aside providing seminars, the proposal does not provide information on how it will directly add value to the Cardano ecosystem and contribute to the growth of the Community. It also does not talk about potential scalability and sustainability of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: A 2 member team is proposed for the project however, details are not provided on the names (except first name: Ariel). Information on the background and experience of the team is not adequate. An external link to a detailed profile would have been helpful. With respect to the budget, the proposer indicates that the contractor gave a ballpark estimate of $20,000 for which he provided a rough breakdown however, the budget is quite general with only 3 budget items. More information will be required on the budget as well. There is no implementation plan in place, only a summary of tasks to be undertaken but no timelines provided to complete them. The proposal generally needs more information to make it complete enough to assess if it is feasible or not.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not provide KPIs or metrics for the monitoring of progress on the project. The information provided is not sufficient to allow for auditability and no provision has been made for updating the Community on the progress of work. It will be quite difficult to audit this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I like how it proposes to utilize existing space to create a community in Costa Rica with classes and events. I would have liked to know more about the Cardano community in Costa Rica. Is it big enough to justify funding for this project? If not, how d
to attract new members? Is the site located near where most members live? These questions would help understand the impact that this project could have. There could be some plan on the activities related to Cardano that they plan on implementing.
f6_assessments.q1:
I am not sure if it fits the category of MVH. I like how there is previous research on how much it would cost but there should be some extra budget for unexpected expenses, as they often occur in construction. I wonder if the budget includes labour force. 
The isn't a clear timeline to show how long the construction would take. It would be important to understand each phase of the construction to see how viable the project is.
The team member seems capable and it is good that he is already involved with the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has clear deliverables that would help monitor each phase. However I would have liked a more clear KPI approaching transparency regarding contracts, and the effect on the Cardano community, for example, the planned events. The construction itself can serve many purposes, so it would be interesting to see some metrics that show that it is being used for and by the Cardano community.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea in this proposal is quite good but the lack of details makes it difficult to give it a good rating. I think that the problem should be articulated better in order to be better understandable. Furthermore, I think that the proposal could fit better in other challenges. My advice to the proposer is to find a better challenge that is more suitable for this project. I also think that the proposer should add key metrics and goals that are aligned with the challenge. For scaling in future challenges, the proposer didn’t mention a plan. I suggest the proposal to rethink the problem they are trying to solve. All start with the problem. If you miss that, it’ll be hard to get good ratings, hence a really low chance of getting funded.
f6_assessments.q1:
My confidence in the feasibility of this project is low. The reason is that the proposer hasn’t provided enough information on its implementation. In order to increase the chances to be funded, I suggest to add the followings:
Add some links, references etc. of the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal.
Add a budget with identifiable items.
Provide a good plan of implementation in case of a successful funding.
Include a timetable to complete the work.
The more details you can add, the more your chance of getting funded increases. However, as the proposal stands at the moment, it is hard to hope for a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks crucial information to be successfully audited. I would suggest to the proposer to add a roadmap with reasonable milestones. I would also add KPIs that define the success of this proposal. My final advice to the proposer is to make sure to add all information needed to increase its chances of being funded.

f6_assessments.q0: It is not easy to find the relevance between the proposal's hub and cardano's community hubs which are of prime importance in this challenge. I do not see why this hub of eco tech space is designed specifically for Cardano's community hubs. There is hardly any the implementation of cryptocurrency in the activities proposed by the hub's presenter. I need more explanation why the implementation of Cardano in this hub is effective.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the presenter show his/her inexperience in relevant fields, he/she presents a designed hub for a small community, which is easily gathered and developed nowadays. However, the money allocation plan seems vague and lacks many important details.
f6_assessments.q2: I need a more informative proposal with in-detailed finance allocation plan, technical aspects, market strategies, and why cardano implementation is important for this specific hub. These aspects should be noted when the proposal presenter composes proposals for later Funds and when he/she adopts this proposal's project in real world scenerio.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer is suggesting an open structure to provide a large community space, where classes can be held, local residents can gather, retreat and hold events. This structure is proposed to be located in a fish farm in Costa Rica. The proposer considers it a "hub of innovation in the eco tech space and retreat for innovators".

The structure allows onboarding of people and practitioners from different fields into the Cardano ecosystem and learning about the Blockchain and interacting. 

The proposal does not mention what is the population size in the local community which I think is important to create an impact on addressing the challenge. As such I can only agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project of construction is done by a contractor whom the proposer relies upon to present the completion schedule. The construction cost is roughly about 20k and there would be an over/under run budget, a concern that he is looking for partners interested in the project.

The proposer has the passion for permaculture and regenerative farming which drives him to work on this project in his land. He "enjoys bringing people together”.  Another team member will teach BJJ seminars and will accept Ada for payment. He has been teaching the locals about Cardano and web3 technology. 

The proposal does not mention how many people will be brought in for interactions, how many classes to be conducted, what kind of events will be held. Perhaps also how people are brought into the regenerative space. I take it that the internet facility is available in the area. The feel of this information should help me to assess the feasibility.

For this, I disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal looks at the physical space for people, especially the Cardano community members to visit. However,  the information on the numbers of visitors, classes, events relating to the Cardano activities etc is absent in the proposal.

As such I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its goals.

solution: We have bought a 15 acre fish farm in Costa Rica which we will be a hub of innovation in the eco tech space and retreat for innovators.
experience: I've been a curiosity driven systems thinker all my life. Combine that with my passion for permaculture and regenerative farming, and you have my compulsion to be the probiotic in my ecosystem! I enjoy bringing people together, and now we have a beautiful rally point to do that!
